definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Two and two halves to the city centre, please.
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，買去市中心的兩張全票和兩張半票。

sentences.english: The board voted unanimously to approve the deal.
sentences.chinese: 董事會全票通過了這筆交易。

sentences.english: When do they start paying full fare?
sentences.chinese: 他們什麼時候開始買全票？

sentences.english: He let virtually all Fatah's delegates attend the congress (a courtesy Hamas did not extend) and in private was generally well-disposed towards its outcome.
sentences.chinese: 事實上阿巴斯曾以全票通過的結果連任成功。

sentences.english: It turned out that she was elected by a unanimous vote.
On first reading, the bill passed unanimously.
sentences.chinese: 該法案在初審時全票通過。

sentences.english: We all passed the bill on yesterday’s board meeting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的董事會上我們全票通過該提案。

definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
non-competitive election (i.e. with as many candidates as there are seats)/single-candidate election
proposal/draft resolution/motion (to be debated)/to propose a bill/to make a proposal
